item.title: Giovanni’s Room
item.description: Not everyone in book club was a fan, but I loved it, but it was brutal, but I’m glad I read it, but I’m glad I won’t be in a rush to read it again. “Somebody,” said Jacques, “your father or mine, should have told us that not many people have ever died of love.

item.title: Yellowface
item.description: After witnessing the accidental death of her frenemy Athena Liu, failed author June Hayward refashions herself as Juniper Song and steals Athena’s posthumous masterpiece to pass it off as her own. Cue white woman tears, as she’s victimized and vilified by the consequences of her own egregious actions.
